history.text: Hello there

Hi! Soo, did you like Macaulay Culkin
 in Home Alone?
Yea home alone is one of my favorite comedies
Can't believe it was released in 1990
Yeah, maybe that's why it has such low ratings?
It's only 62% on Rotten Tomatoes...
You think the new generation doesn't appreciate it
although it did receive an A on Cinemascore
I cannot imagine who wouldn't like, as one reviewer said, "sadistic festival of adult-bashing"
That sounds, and is, so fun
Yep, especially when the supporting actors are Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern. It's a comedy overdose
Also I think everyone has such siblings and cousins like Kevin has, who always ridicule him. Lots of people can relate to him.
Haha, yeah i remember that scene in the beginning when he's fighting with his brother Buzz, he gets punished and sent to his room
But how much everyone had to rush to leave a son behind... This is insane
Yea, i think it happened because of a malfunction in the alarm clock, what are the odds happening on the night of the flight

I'm glad we have smartphones now, less chance of this kind of happening like oversleeping
!
Yeah, the Director Chris Columbus did an excellent job in this movie, do you know if it won any awards?
Oh no, sorry, I don't know. but I would be amazed if it didn't win any.
I might look it up later, i'm remembering the scene when the mom realizes Kevin is missing while sitting on the plane
Yeah, that scene was so funny and so scary at the same time. The feeling of leaving your kid thousands kilometers away...
yea and what's funnier is when she was stuck with that Polka band to go back and find him
Well, moms will do anything to get back with her son, even travel with the polka band, lol!
I think she was forced to because all flights were booked
But it was fun times for Kevin at least! Preparing all of those booby traps looked so interesting
Yea, what i didn't understand is how those thieves remained active after all those injuries hahaha
This is a comedy genre after all, hahe.
Oh how stupid they were actually. Leaving all of the burgled houses with the tap on was so unsmart for them.
Why was it, to flood them?
Yup, like what's the point of that...
True, just like some critics were cynical that an 8 year old boy is able to devise all these booby traps, i think the movie did intentionally have some weird plot twists like that
It was nice chatting to you, bye
